title: Ribbon Cutting - White Cap Street Cafe
description:
Join the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce as we celebrate the Ribbon Cutting Celebration for White Cap Street Cafe! Join in the celebration on October 1st at 9:00AM located at 5601 Ayllon Ave! 



White Cap Street Cafe is an all-day breakfast eatery that also features lunch after 10:30AM. Fresh pastries, green chile breakfast burritos, breakfast sammies, and homemade conecuh and sausage gravy over biscuits. A little nook tucked back away from traffic under Cyprus trees on the corner of Ayllon Street.
location: White Cap Street Cafe 5601 Ayllon Ave Pensacola, FL

description:

location: The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce Conference Room. 15500 Perdido Key Drive Pensacola, FL 32507

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "Launching a Home-Based Childcare Business"
description:
Compassion, entrepreneurship, and addressing a critical need. Register for this insightful workshop to learn how to run a successful at-home childcare business in the area.

 

To help meet the demand for childcare services in Northwest Florida, address the current economic climate, and assist entrepreneurs, we're offering this special workshop in 2025. We'll cover in-home childcare business start-up steps and best practices, including popular methods, legalities, finances, profitability, and how to receive continued help.

 

After attending this start-up workshop, you'll have access to a Florida SBDC Business Consultant to assist you at no cost and confidentially as you fine-tune your business plan and move toward your at-home childcare small business goals!

 

Lunch will be provided.
location: Early Learning Coalition of Escambia County 1720 W Fairfield Dr Suite 400 Pensacola, FL 32501

title: Throwback Family Game Night

location: Perdido Key Sports Bar & Restaurant

title: Holes Fore Hope
description:
Holes Fore Hope is a four person scramble where each player has a chance to advance their team to the winners' circle. Mulligans are available for purchase at the beginning of the tournament, and contests for other prizes are set throughout the course. Competitions include longest drive, the closest putt, and don't forget our famous ball drop!

The tournament also includes a 50/50 raffle, basket raffles and more, in which all participants and guests are welcome to participate. All proceeds from this tournament go to helping support the programs and services of The Centre For Excellence of Pensacola. 



As a non-profit organization, The Centre for Excellence of Pensacola relies on monthly donors, government and private grants, as well as our annual fundraisers for the resources we need to impact lives in our community. Holes Fore Hope is the Centre's Annual Charity Golf Tournament that helps support the Centre's programs and services throughout the entirety of the following year, including: A.W.A.R.E. Initiative, Community Table, Hand Up Practical Skills Classes, andJamie's Mom's House.
location: Osceola Golf course 300 Tonawanda Dr, Pensacola, FL 32506

description: Join us for our 9th Oktoberfest on Sunday, October 5th from 1:00 to 5:00 p.m. Enjoy great German food, modern polka music by The Brats, Stein hoisting, games, and tons of Oktoberfest-style beers and german wines. title: 25/26 Leadership Perdido Key - Class 2 Tourism
description:
Leaders are not born; they are developed. We must ensure the success of our community by cultivating talented individuals who will emerge and lead us into the future. There is no better training ground for our future leaders than Leadership Perdido Key (LPK). The keys to the future of Northwest Florida are knowledgeable and skilled leaders who have an awareness and understanding of all facets of our community, including local government, business, tourism/hospitality, environment, military, and more.



Leadership Perdido Key is a comprehensive leadership development program designed to empower individuals with the skills, knowledge, and networking needed to become effective leaders in their communities. 

Participants in Leadership Perdido Key will come from diverse backgrounds and industries, reflecting the community's rich tapestry of talent and expertise. Through a series of workshops, seminars, and experiential learning activities, participants have the opportunity to deepen their understanding of Perdido Key area and hone their leadership capabilities.

The program will feature guest speakers who are prominent leaders in various fields, providing valuable insights.  Additionally, participants may engage in hands-on projects and community initiatives aimed at making a positive impact in Perdido Key and surrounding areas.

Overall, Leadership Perdido Key aims to cultivate a new generation of leaders who are equipped to address the challenges and opportunities facing their communities, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and service.



Click here to download information & application packet

Application deadline is August 1, 2025



Sponsorship information



 
The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce extends its congratulations to the following individuals selected for the 2025-26 Leadership Perdido Key class:

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "Starting a Business"
description:
So you've got that business idea. You may not know the first steps, or you may want some guidance on if you're taking the right steps. Let's work with the ideas that have been forming in your head and see if we can make them into a tangible, feasible small business. In this three-hour workshop, we'll take a deep dive into the following aspects of setting up a successful business:

 


	Is there a need for your product or service?
	Can you make money at it?
	Are you the right person to bring this to market?
	Is this business compatible with your personal goals?
	What rules, laws, and licensing apply to your business?
	What are funding options for your business?
	What about marketing strategies, legal structures, and taxation?
	What are your available resources?


Also, after attending this workshop you'll have access to a Florida SBDC Business Consultant to assist you at no cost as you create your business plan and move toward your goals!

 

*UWF students and employees may attend SBDC workshops at no cost. Contact us at 850-474-2528 to register with your Nautilus Card number.

 

Please note: No refund credit without 48-hour notice. Contact us at sbdc@uwf.edu or 850-474-2528 with questions.

 

Brought to you in part by Wells Fargo.
location: Gulf Breeze Area Chamber of Commerce 3044 Gulf Breeze Parkway, Gulf Breeze, Florida 32563

title: 2025 Perdido Palooza Community Party
description:
Perdido Palooza is a vibrant monthly community party that brings people together in a fun, festive atmosphere! Hosted by the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce and Warrior Beer Company, this event is designed to celebrate the spirit and charm of the Perdido community! Held from May through October, each month features live performances from talented musicians, craft beer, local food trucks, and a strong focus on supporting the community through partnerships with local businesses and artisans.

 

What to Expect at Perdido Palooza:

  Enjoy live music

   Shop & visit with local vendors and businesses 

  Savor craft beer brewed on-site by Warrior Beer Company

  Connect with friends, neighbors, and the community while supporting local talent and our local businesses.

 

When: The second Thursday of every month, from May through October.



Interested in being a part of the event? Check out the sponsorship information and the vendor information here!

 

Celebrate local, enjoy the best of Perdido Key, and join us at Perdido Palooza for an unforgettable experience. Let's raise a glass to community, music, food, and fun!

 
 



All sales are final and non-refundable. The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce will not be responsible for reselling your booth space if you are unable to attend.



By attending this event, you consent to photography, video recording, and its/their release, publication, or reproduction to be used by the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce for promotional purposes, including on social media, websites, and other marketing materials.
location: Warrior Beer Company 10605 Sorrento Rd, Pensacola, FL 32507

title: October Spill the Beans, Community Conversations 2025
description:
The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce presents Spill the Beans, Community Conversations, a series designed to bring the local community together to explore topics that have a direct impact on residents and businesses in and around Perdido Key.



Each session provides an opportunity for attendees to learn about key issues and developments affecting the area, followed by a Q&A session to encourage open dialogue. 



This month's speaker is 

Cinnamon Swift, Secret Santa INC. 



Formed in 1992 in Perdido Key, the organization raises funds year-round to support families and children especially at Christmas and during times of urgent medical or housing needs. Each holiday season, they help families shop for gifts, making sure children experience the joy and excitement of Christmas morning. Beyond the holidays, they step in when hardships arise, offering vital assistance and reassurance to those facing difficult times. The spirit of giving is carried on well beyond the holiday season, bringing hope, comfort, and community support throughout the year.



Light pastries and coffee will be available for attendees, provided courtesy of our host, Hub Stacey's at The Point, while supplies last. Whether you're looking to stay informed about local issues or expand your network, Spill the Beans offers a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere to engage with community leaders and fellow business owners.
location: Hub Stacey's at the Point 5851 Galvez Road Pensacola, FL 32507

title: Howl-o-ween
description:
Bring the whole family, two-legged and four-legged, for Howl-o-ween in Downtown OWA on October 11th! Kids can enjoy free crafts, face painting, carnival games, and festive activities, while pups get their chance to shine in the Halloween Dog Costume Contest on OWA Island. With categories like Cutest, Funniest, Spookiest, and Best Owner/Dog Duo, furry contestants can win cash prizes up to $100. Registration is just $10 in advance or $15 the day of, with all proceeds benefiting the Baldwin County Animal Shelter. After the contest, stick around for Island Movie Night featuring Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed. It's a paw-some way to celebrate Halloween with the whole family while giving back to a great cause!



Register your pup for the Halloween Costume Contest today: https://visitowa.com/howl-o-ween/
location: Downtown OWA

title: A Choral Society Mixtape
description: THE CHORAL SOCIETY of PENSACOLA: PRESENTS A Choral Society Mixtape on Saturday, October 11, 2025 at 7:30pm. Over many months, concertgoers responded via survey voting on pieces they'd like to hear us perform. We've chosen a varied program from the requests, ranging from familiar to rarely heard. The Choral Society of Pensacola invites music lovers to experience this concert, in the sanctuary of Cokesbury Church (5725 North Ninth Avenue). The concert also includes   "One Day More" from Les Miserables (Claude-Michel Schonberg)   the clear winner according to the polls   "Lacrymosa" from Requiem (Mozart)   a close runner-up and audience favorite   "Bridge Over Troubled Water" (Paul Simon, arr. Shaw)   "Sure on This Shining Night" (Morten Lauridsen)   "Daemon Irrepit Callidus" (Gyorgy Orban) Directing our 105-voice chorus, we are excited to welcome back two Directors-Emeritus: Xiaolun Chen and Paul McGahie alongside current Artistic Director Peter Steenblik. They are joined by pianist Isabelle Areola. Steenblik will post a preview of the program on the Choral Society's YouTube channel on Monday, September 29th. Tickets may be purchased at Purplepass.com or through the Pensacola State College Department of Performing Arts ticket office (850-484-1847). For concerns about accessibility or any other questions, email support@choralsocietyofpensacola.org.
location: Cokesbury Church 5725 N 9th Ave, Pensacola, FL 32504

title: Flora-Bama Annual Oktoberfest
description:
Sunday, October 12th



3pm to 6pm

Break out your lederhosen for the Flora-Bama's Oktoberfest! Receive a free drink upon entry for those 21 and up, 25% off in the gift shop, and complimentary German food from the buffet (while supplies last). The stein hoisting competition sponsored by Samuel Adams will begin at 3pm. Food is served at 4pm and the menu includes Beer Brats, Sauerkraut, and German Potato Salad.

We have a FREE stein to those who participate in the stein hoisting contest. Followed by live music by The Brats at 4pm in the Bama Dome. This New Orleans based polka band will have you laughing and dancing all evening!

Timeline of Events:

2pm - Registration Begins for Stein Hoisting Competition. We will only accept the first 8 females to sign up for the female heat and the first 16 males to sign up for the two male heats. 

3pm - Stein Hoisting Competition Begins

4pm - Food is served and The Brats begin
location: Flora-Bama Lounge Package & Oyster Bar 17401 Perdido Key Dr. Perdido Key, FL. 32507

title: Annual Multi-Chamber Social 2025
description:
The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce is thrilled to invite all the members of our local Gulf Coast chambers of commerce to our Annual Multi-Chamber Social, hosted by Flora-Bama, located in the main tent!

This exciting event is a fantastic opportunity for professionals from our chamber friends across the local Gulf Coast area to network and foster collaboration! Join us for an evening of connection, community, and business growth!



Enjoy light hors d'oeuvres, generously provided by our host, as you mingle and expand your network. Be sure to bring plenty of your business cards for networking and prize drawings door prize donations are always welcome!

We can't wait to see you there! Registration is highly encouraged to help our hosts prepare. Don't forget, drop your Chamber in the comments of your registration so we can see who is being represented!

title: Military Appreciation Committee Meeting
description:
Military Appreciation Committee

Meeting: Second Thursday of every month | 9:30 10:30 a.m.



Committee Purpose:

Since 1913, the Perdido Area has proudly held the title of Cradle of Naval Aviation. Our economy, culture, and community are enriched by military members and their families. The Military Affairs Committee is dedicated to honoring that legacy by fostering inclusion, appreciation, and strong connections with those who serve, making the Perdido Area a welcoming place for military families to live, work, and play.



Primary Goals and Activities:


	Bridge the Gap: Connect military families with the local business community by sharing resources and supporting veteran entrepreneurs.
	Celebrate Military Heritage: Educate our community about the rich military history that shapes the Perdido Area.
	Honor & Support: Plan and host signature events that highlight our appreciation for service members and their families, including:
	
		Red, White, and Birdies Golf Scramble 
		Annual Rosamond Johnson Memorial Ceremony 
		Military Appreciation Luncheon 
		Star Spangled Sail   Veterans Day Boat Parade (new for 2025)
	
	
	Invest in the Future: Our committee is working toward sponsoring a local student to attend Starbase Atlantis and/or the National Flight Academy summer programs unique opportunities that inspire the next generation through STEM education and leadership development.

How to Get Involved:

Join us in making a difference! Volunteers can contact Staff Committee Chair, Madelyn Bell, to learn how to participate in meetings, help with events, and support military appreciation efforts.



  Learn more: perdidochamber.com/military-appreciation-committee
location: Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce Conference Room 15500 Perdido Key Drive Pensacola, FL 32507

title: Ambassadors of the Key Committee Meeting
description:
Ambassadors of the Key Committee Meeting

3rd Friday Monthly | 11:30AM | Location Changes Monthly 



Ambassador meetings are held once a month on the 3rd Friday at 11:30 AM at a different member restaurant each month. These meetings provide a great opportunity to connect, share updates, and collaborate on upcoming Chamber initiatives. Each Ambassador is responsible for the purchase of their own meal.



The Ambassadors of the Key serve as the welcoming arm of the Perdido Chamber, focusing on member recruitment, retention, and engagement. This dedicated group of business and individual members acts as the connectors within our chamber community. They work to help members get plugged in by introducing them to fellow business professionals, Chamber events, and valuable resources.



Ambassadors help create a welcoming environment for new and existing members, assist with Chamber-hosted events, and work to increase visibility and engagement. Ambassadors try to ensure that every member feels welcomed, informed, and empowered to make the most of their Chamber membership.



For more information on how to become an Ambassador of the Key, contact Madelyn Bell, Membership Engagement & Events Director at 850.492.4660 or membership@perdidochamber.com.
location: Location Changes Monthly

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "Google AI University"
description:
Are you a small business owner looking to get ahead in the digital age? Artificial Intelligence (AI) is no longer just a futuristic concept it's a powerful tool that can streamline your operations, enhance customer engagement, and drive growth right now.

Join us for Google AI University, a special workshop designed specifically for small business owners, funded in part by Google, and delivered by an ASBDC AI certified trainer. This is your opportunity to understand the foundational concepts of AI and learn practical, actionable ways to implement it into your business today.

 

What You'll Learn:


	AI Explained: Get a clear, jargon-free overview of what AI is and how it's currently being used by businesses of all sizes.
	Practical Business Applications: Discover specific, accessible ways AI can immediately impact your daily operations, including:
	
		Saving Time on administrative tasks with AI-powered tools.
		Creating High-Quality Content (emails, social media posts, blog drafts) faster than ever before.
		Improving Customer Service and personalizing interactions.
		Analyzing Data to make smarter business decisions.
	
	
	Actionable Next Steps: Walk away with a clear roadmap for adopting AI responsibly and making your first smart AI investments.
location: Greater Pensacola Chamber of Commerce 418 W Garden St, CO:LAB Bldg, 4th flr Pensacola, FL 32501

title: Sunset Grille Dog Walk 2025
description:
Bring your furry friend to Sunset Grille in Perdido Key, Florida for their Annual Dog Walk!

For a casual one-mile walk starting at Sunset Grille, walking down scenic Old River Road, and finishing at the dog park on River Road (along the Intracoastal Waterway).

After the walk, stick around for a pet costume contest, live festivities, and the perfect ending to the day watching the sunset from your table at the Grille.

100% of proceeds benefit Save Underdogs, a local Perdido Key rescue and adoption organization dedicated to helping dogs find loving homes.
location: Sunset Grille 14050 Canal A Way Drive, Pensacola, FL 32507

title: 5th Annual Perdido Key Witches & Werewolves Halloween Paddle Ride
description:
Save the Date, Spooky Paddlers! ?? ???? ??

The most exciting recreational community fundraising event on the Key is back!

Join us for the 5th Annual Witches & Werewolves Halloween Paddle Ride & Bar Crawl   a wickedly fun paddle route turned Halloween tradition in Perdido Key!

 


	When: Sunday, October 26 @ 12:00 PM
	Where: Galvez Landing, Perdido Key
	Who: 21+
	Why: Feeding the Gulf Coast Fundraiser
	How Much: $25
	Costume Contest: Dress to impress (or distress!)+ badass local Prizes
	Jam to local live music with us on the exclusive Spell Isle!


Chills, thrills & paddling spills! Grab your broomsticks, capes, and claws whether you're casting spells or howling at the sun, or playing in our games, this eerie adventure on the water is one you won't want to miss!

The Head Witches are gathering all of the ingredients for a WICKEDLY awesome party!! More details brewing soon  stay tuned & follow us on Facebook for detailed info, if you dare!
location: Galvez Landing- Innerarity Point, Perdido Key, Florida

title: Trunk or Treat
description: ???? You're Invited to Trunk or Treat at Green Line Arms! ???? Get ready for a night of candy, costumes, and community fun! This year we're teaming up with some amazing partners to make it bigger and better than ever: ?? Green Line Arms   hosting the event + opening our Virtual Range with a Pumpkin Shooter Challenge and Zombie Survival Game! ?? Coastal Pop   mixing up spooky specialty sodas & Halloween treats! ?? Big Moose BBQ   serving up delicious food hot off the smoker! ??? Vet Cola Foundation   sharing their mission while supporting our local military families. ? Plus: Trunk-to-trunk trick-or-treating, games for kids of all ages, and lots more spooky surprises to come! ?? 26 October - 4-7pm ?? Green Line Arms   1350 S. Blue Angel Parkway ??? FREE | Open to ALL families (with a special salute to our military and first responder community) Grab your costumes, bring the kids, and join us for a safe & festive Halloween night! ??????
location: 1350 S. Blue Angel Parkway

title: 2025 Red, White, and Birdies Golf Scramble
description:
Tee up for a great cause at the 2025 Red, White, and Birdies Golf Scramble, Presented by Printing Pros, a premier fundraising event supporting our military programs and initiatives through the Perdido Key Area Chamber's Military Appreciation Committee. 



Join the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce on Monday, October 27th, at 10am for an afternoon of camaraderie and competition at the beautiful A.C. Read Golf Course on Naval Air Station, Pensacola. Enjoy a day on the greens while contributing to initiatives that benefit our local military community.



EVENT DETAILS: 

Location: A.C. Read Golf Course, NAS Pensacola, 1313 Duncan Road, Pensacola, FL

Date: Monday, October 27th

Time: Shotgun start at 10:00 a.m. (Lunch served at the turn)



Important Information: To gain access to A.C. Read Golf Course, all participants who do not have a military I.D. must complete the 5512 Security Form. Please download the form and complete and send it to Madelyn Bell, membership@perdidochamber.com by October 10th. Click here for the 5512 Security form.



PRICING: 


	Teams:

	
		Perdido Chamber Member Team: $500
		Military Team with I.D.: $400
		Non-Member Team: $600
	
	



	Individuals:

	
		Perdido Chamber Member Golfer: $125
		Military Golfer with I.D.: $100
		Non-Member Golfer: $150
	
	


For those looking to enhance their participation, a variety of sponsorship opportunities are available. Click here for sponsorship information.



Don't miss out on this chance to support a worthy cause while enjoying a day of golf with friends and colleagues. Sign up today!
location: A.C. Read Golf Course Naval Air Station Pensacola 1313 Duncan Road Pensacola, FL

title: Music Bingo at Lillian's Pizza
description: Kick off your weekend early with Music Bingo by Team Trivia every Monday at Lillian's Pizza! We'll be spinning hits from the 60s to the 2000s covering all your favorite genres. It's FREE to play, and we've got prizes for every winner! Come early, grab some dinner or drinks, and enjoy a fun night of music and good vibes. We start at 7 PM see you there!
location: Lillian's Pizza 14514 Perdido Key Drive, Pensacola 32507 850-492-0131

title: Women Mean Business Sunset Sail 2025
description:
Presented by Sail Wild Hearts & Women Mean Business 

Ladies, let's sail into the sunset together! Join us on Wednesday, October 29th from 4:45 6:45 PM for an exclusive evening aboard Wild Hearts, a 53-ft. sailing catamaran. With room for 49 guests, it's the perfect way to unwind, connect, and enjoy breathtaking Gulf views with fellow Perdido Chamber ladies.



The sail is generously donated by Sail Wild Hearts. Ticket fees help cover refreshments and gratuity for their incredible crew!



Location: Sail Wild Hearts, 27101 Perdido Beach Blvd, Orange Beach (across from Perdido Beach Resort)

On Board: Light snacks will be provided. You're welcome to bring your favorite beverages and small cooler (no glass).

Tickets: $25 Chamber Members | $40 Non-Members

Deadline: Space is limited. Reserve your spot by October 22nd!



This is more than just a cruise it's an opportunity to relax, mingle, and share an unforgettable evening on the water with the Women Mean Business Committee. Secure your spot today and join us for sunset views, laughter, and great company!

 






*All ticket sales are final and tickets are non-refundable. The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce will not be responsible for reselling tickets if you are unable to attend. 



*By attending this event, you consent to photography, video recording, and its/their release, publication, or reproduction to be used by the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce for promotional purposes, including on social media, websites, and other marketing materials.
location: WILD HEARTS is located in Orange Beach, Alabama directly across the street from Perdido Beach Resort 27101 Perdido Beach Blvd. (Hwy 182) We are docked on the north side of the highway on Cotton Bayou directly across the street from the Perdido Beach Resort. Just look for the signs directing you to the parking area and look for the tall mast on our bright yellow catamaran.
